page.title: 12E.Hoathly Carnival Society
page.content: This society is one of the most active. It has approximately one hund- red paid up members. Each year it org- anises a Bonfire Night Celebration in memory of all those killed in the wars. The climax of this exciting evening is a huge firework spectacu- lar. Preparations take a whole year and the theme is a closely guarded secret. During the evening there is a procession. The society members dress as North American Indians or as Cowboys. People make their own costumes. Many other Carnival Societ- ies, in their colourful costumes, join the parade with the visting bands to add to the atmosphere. Approximately 9000 people attend and the money raised goes to charity. On the following Sunday members parade and attend a special Rememberance Day Service at the Village Church.
